article_text:
During the 2008 financial crisis, “too big to fail” became a familiar phrase in the U.S. financial system. Now the U.S. health-care system is heading down the same path with a record number of hospital mergers and acquisitions—95 last year—some creating regional monopolies that, as in all monopolies, will likely result in higher prices from decreased competition.

Hospital consolidation, done properly in a competitive marketplace, can have positive effects. Multi-hospital conglomerates can quickly disseminate best...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Dr. Marty Makary writes that last year saw 95 hospital mergers and acquisitions in the U.S., a frenzy encouraged by the Affordable Care Act.
twitter.title: The ObamaCare Effect: Hospital Monopolies
